metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4472 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The overflow protection in Expat is removed by compilers with certain optimization settings, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via crafted XML data. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2015-1283 and CVE-2015-2716.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.1-1ubuntu1
libexpat1 - 2.1.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

libxmltok1 - 1.2-4ubuntu0.20.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> fixed in USN-2983-1 in the CVE-2015-1283-refix.patch patch ebarretto> tla uses system expat as of 1.3.5+dfsg-15

criterions.comment: cadaver package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
coin3 package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
expat package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1ubuntu1').
libxmltok package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-4ubuntu0.20.04.1~esm1').
matanza package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
swish-e package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
tla package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
xmlrpc-c package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
